title: Kerala
creator_contributor_role: Documentary Films of India, production company
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/India - Description and travel
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/India - Social life and customs
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/India - Social conditions
description: A picture of Kerala State in south-west India. A flat fertile land with many waterways supporting a dense population; many crops including spices, for which the district was known to the Arabs and Phoenicians; Vasco da Gama and the history of Kerala; the Byzantine influence in the city of Trivandrum; paintings and sculptures in the museum and much more including the life and customs of the people.
